channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Big cluster of pot holes in the road just by the turning into Charlton Court Road, 2nd April
item.description:
As you turn off the London rd, the potholes are by the left hand curb, just opposite the turning to Charlton Court Rd, by some garages. Theyâ€™ve been getting worse over several months and are now larger and deeper.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Poor drainage on narrow public footpath, extremely muddy / hazardous, 1st April
item.description:
Public footpath near Korinn Farm, running alongside the bush. Hazardous mud on narrow footpath. Broken ankle suffered by hiker
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Coberley, Cotswold

item.title: Whole road still not tarmaced, 1st April
item.description:
Whole of sapphire way between main road of sapphire way and gauntlet road still not tarmacced. Damage causing to cars with ridiculously high kerbs and drain holes. Houses have been built for almost 15 years now!!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Golden Arrow Way, Upton St. Leonards, Stroud
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in airport junction, 1st April
item.description:
The centre of the road has a pothole, right in the middle of the airport T-junction.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bamfurlong Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ground water lifting road surface, 1st April
item.description:
Patched repair is being lifted by water. Severn Trent have attended and stated that this is ground water as they tested it and found no chlorine present. Presumably the new supermarket adjacent has changed the groundwater characteristics here and caused this problem. This water is rising from the road surface and flowing down the road and pooling. This standing water is what led to the failure of the road surface which has required resurfacing.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, North Road West, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Mud on footpath, 1st April
item.description:
Accumulation of leaf mulch has left parts of the footpath inches deep in mud and slippery in places. Is it possible for a street sweeper to clean this path? Access for a small street sweeper would be possible from either Hazebrouck Close or the end of Ennerdale Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Hazebrouck Close, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Patch of failed road surface, 1st April
item.description:
Opposite Wade Close, on the Westbound lane, a large patch of failed road surface. Has been repaired many many times already but is now sinking. Defect is the width of the lane so is impossible to avoid.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hatherley Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep potholes, 1st April
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oldbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Very slow drain, 1st April
item.description:
Drain on the corner of Rippledale Close and Hatherley Road, on the roundabout side of the junction. Is very slow draining and water often extends two metres into the carriageway making it very difficult for pedestrians to cross. No rain for 24 hours today and there is still standing water at the drain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 248, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury

item.title: Huge potholes, Road surface pretty much non existent, 1st April
item.description:
Heavy water damage to road surface. Potholes are very deep, anything above 5mph is impossible. Problem runs the whole way from the bottom of the valley by the logging roads all the way up into Cowley village itself.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cowley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole, 1st April
item.description:
On left lane of eastbound carriage of A40 directly next to layby. Quite significant sized pothole that is hard to avoid without some moving over in lane due to position.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 312, Prestbury Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Drain blocked nr Hartley lane causing flooding, 1st April
item.description:
The drain opposite Greenhill on Leckhampton hill is blocked and when heavy rain floods the road causing passing cars to wash the flood down our drive risking flood to garage and property .. please address this asap Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Hill, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Traffic light sequence wrong, 1st April
item.description:
The green filter light comes on even when no vehicle is waiting to turn right into greenways meaning the red light is on too often and too long for traffic going east. The lights take too long to change for traffic leaving Greenways.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Barnwood Road, Barnwood, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working
